intro: Caccinia macranthera var. eumacranthera, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a tropical species native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its striking, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a vibrant display during the warmer months. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets that provide a lush green canopy. Its flowering stems are often branched and can grow quite tall, making it a striking addition to gardens. The botanical features of this plant make it well-suited for tropical and subtropical climates, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
